acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ford Foundation archive was deposited at the RAC in 2011. Ford Foundation records, correspondence, reports, program files, and officers' papers were transferred to and accessioned by the RAC beginning in 2011. This material was transferred to the RAC in 2019 and was ingested by the RAC as Accession 2019:083.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Joy Carol was a Program Officer within the Education and Public Policy and Urban Poverty Programs at the Ford Foundation from 1980-1982. Within these programs, she focused on youth employment and women in educational leadership. After leaving the Ford Foundation, Carol went on to work for the United Nations Development Programme, Save the Children USA, the Child Fund, and the International Women's Tribune Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection includes internal memos and correspondence regarding grants for education and women's equality within the Ford Foundation's Education and Public Policy and Urban Poverty programs.
